**WORLD WINDOWS GENERAL CONTRACTING, LTD, CO.** 

**MR Nova Kojaian** 

**AND**

**ADVANCED PIPELINE SERVICES** 

**Dr. Falah Mustafa**

**&** 

**WATER ENGINEERING TECHNOLOGIES, INC.**

**Dr. Saad Ghalib**

**\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**

**CONFIDENTIAL**

**Final Agreement** 

**\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**

**THIS TERM SHEET** (the “**Term Sheet**”) is dated as of 23rd September 2023.

**BETWEEN:** 

The joint venture for the project:  

1.  **Windows General Contracting Ltd. Co** (WWGCC)
    

registered in the Companies Registrar Department / Ministry of Commerce No. 26004 on 2/5/2005.

**Advance Pipeline Services, (ADPS)**

Registration Number 34126 on 13/04/2021

Address: 21, 56th Street Al Wahdah District 904, Baghdad, **Iraq** 

Called First Party within this agreement.

2.  **Water Engineering Technologies (WET),** a Michigan corporation having its registered office at 2626 Packard Rd Ann Arbor, Michigan 48104. 
    

Called Second Party within this agreement.

Each individually referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties".

**THE PROJECT**: The Medical City wastewater project AND / OR The Zuyut Factory Pump station Waste Treatment Plant (WWTP) in Baghdad 

**BACKGROUND**:

1.  All parties aim to market, bid for, and secure design/build/operate contract for the Project as outlined in this document.
    
2.  The Parties are interested in cooperating jointly to leverage the expertise of each individual or the collective expertise on agreed terms.
    
3.  All references to currency in this Term Sheet are in US dollars.
    

**NOW, THEREFORE, THE PARTIES HAVE AGREED TO THE FOLLOWING TERMS AS STATED IN THIS WRITTEN AGREEMENT.** 

1.  **Contractual Relationship.**  The Parties will provide shared services for The Project using the Second Party’s Treatment Shaft technology.  Both WWTPs average capacity are in the range of 150,000 m3/day.   Parties’ contractual relationship and responsibilities are presented in Exhibit A and B.  The parties signing this agreement will operate in their preferred locality. Specific terms and responsibilities among the parties are detailed in Exhibit C and Exhibit D.
    

1.  The two parties in this agreement shall do their best to qualify for their participation and display their technical capabilities appropriately to win the projects and use for that purpose their accumulated experience and updated market studies.
    
2.  Each Party bears its administrative expenses separately, except those directly related to the project after obtaining the contract with the Municipality and as agreed by both parties in this agreement. 
    
3.  The two parties undertake to spend the amounts obtained through the Municipality (beneficiary entity) and as detailed in the proposal exclusively for the purpose of completing the work on the Project as it is not permissible to spend any amount, whatever its value, on any other project, regardless of its importance, and under any pretext or reason, except with the agreement of the three parties. The amounts of funds for the above project shall be received from the Municipality and the process of disbursing the fund is limited to the First Party only or their officially authorized representatives, (except in the cases of design and technology related expenditure, then it is a joint decision between the first and second party). 
    
4.  Approval of submittals including mechanical, electrical, structural, and other submittals that deviate from original design will be the responsibility of the Second Party.
    
5.  During the preparation of the First Party proposal for this project many assumptions and estimates were made for the lack of available information.  The First Party is advised to add a reasonable design and construction contingencies to accommodate any overseen conditions that may affect the actual cost.  
    
6.  The two parties are obligated to inform each other of any communications received out of context, received from other parties related to the participation, regardless of their type (photocopies or by e-mail). The two parties are also to attend when needed at the headquarters of the Municipality or any other department for the purpose of providing administrative and legal facilities (requirements). 
    
7.  The two parties have no right to sell the contract (secretly or publicly) to any person, group, or any company, whether (Iraqi, Arab, or foreign) under any reason unless agreed by both parties.
    
8.  The provisions of this agreement apply to any changes that may occur during the implementation of the project, whether it is deleting or creating paragraphs, stopping work for a specific period, canceling some parts of the project, or withholding advances for a specific period, and they are binding on their application (physically and legally). 
    

\[\[\[

9.  This participation agreement does not prevent either Party from independently entering separate contractual obligations (in any other projects), and this does not entail any obligations for the other Party. 
    
10.  In the event of a dispute, the parties to this Agreement will use their best efforts to resolve the dispute amicably. Otherwise, the parties will seek arbitration to resolve the dispute through a three-person dispute review committee independent of the signatory parties to this Agreement. Each party chooses its representative on the dispute review committee, and the two members of the dispute review committee choose the third member of the dispute review committee. If the parties do not agree on the dispute review committee’s recommendation, it will be referred to the competent courts in Baghdad, Iraq, and its decision will be binding on both parties.
    

2.  **PARTY 1 Contributions**
    

As per details found in Exhibit C

3.  **PARTY 2 Contributions.** 
    

1.  Offering use of its patented technology and expertise in designing Treatment Shaft technology for the Project. 
    
2.  Assisting the municipality and the First Party in implementing Treatment Shaft technology.
    
3.  Completion of the first WWTP project, namely Medical City in Baghdad, with a capacity of 150,000 m3/day within the agreement's term and (the second project) (??). 
    
4.  Provide (concept), preliminary, and final engineering design, to ensure project completion according to the project intent. Specific responsibilities are listed in Exhibit D.
    
5.  The second party is obliged to provide consultant engineers in different disciplines representing the design team to respond to the requirements of the construction team (First Party) (Both parties shall decide on the recruitment and commissioning of design team including all required disciplines). 
    
6.  Assigning a representative as oversite engineer(s) to oversee construction activities and respond to field conditions that required design team input and to facilitate First Party performance upon their request. Staffing, responsibilities and communications protocols between the First Party and the Second Party for the oversight engineers will be developed by the Second Party at the beginning of the construction work.  
    

4.  **Compensation of the Second Party:** 
    

As per this agreement the Second Party will be paid by the First Party as follows:

1.  Royalty fee: Lump sum of 3,000,000 USD, to be paid as follows:
    

1.  Lump sum of 150,000 USD during the process of the development of the design.
    
2.  Lump sum of 150,000 USD upon the approval of the final design by an Independent International Consultant commissioned by the Client (commissioning and hand over of the project).
    
3.  The remaining to be paid prorata to the payments received (?) 
    

2.  Detailed Design: Complete design of the project is budgeted at actual cost. The actual cost will be determined after selecting the design consultant which will be selected by second party and approved by first party. The second party will be responsible for the payments only. An agreement will be signed by both parties with the Design party. The final design budget will include the contracted fee agreed with the design consultant and WET staff support selected by the Second Party and approved by the First Party. Payments will be based on actual terms of payment with the design Consultant and support staff.  Because of the preliminary nature of the design and lack of basic information, any expenses beyond the design budget determined at the beginning of the design work, will be reviewed, approved and paid by the First Party. 
    
3.  Payment for the time and expenses for the team assisting in the QA/QC and third-party review, and improvement of the design, as needed, will be covered at actual cost.  The team will consist mainly of senior consultants selected by the Second Party who worked on this type of projects.  Disciplines of the team will include but not limited to Process, structural, M/E, instrumentation and control and hydraulics.
    
4.  The payment of the Construction oversight team will be at actual cost billed by second party and paid by the First Party on a monthly basis .
    
5.  The Second Party will be paid a18% profit sharing in USD for the above project. 
    
6.  Profit is calculated as contract value minus direct construction cost including time, material, equipment, financial expenses, taxes, design, Royalty fees, contractor overhead and expenses and any fees related to the project excluding any expenses not related to project costs.
    
7.  For other future projects the fees and expenses and method of payment will be mutually decided between both parties on a project-by-project basis.   
    

5.  **Payment terms**  
    
    1.  Item 4-e profit sharing will be paid upon achieving positive cash flow but with secured successful end of the project. Profit-sharing payment schedule will be agreed upon by the Parties as such will not effect the cash flow to finish the contract smoothly and successfully
        
    2.  All parties have the right to have access on the accountings periodically. Regular monthly reports will be provided by the accountant to all parties.
        
    3.  Payments in Item 4 (b,c and d ) will be paid on a monthly basis  for the completed works and will include 15% to cover overheads of the Second Party.
        
6.  **Confidential Information:** Recipient of Second Party specific confidential/patented technology information agrees to restrict its use of such information to the purpose of this Agreement and will not permit any other use of the same without the prior written consent of the Second Party.  
    

7.  **Warranties:** Both parties warrant the following: 
    

1.  No ongoing or pending lawsuits to their knowledge that effect their financial and operational capability. 
    
2.  Neither Party's history includes insolvency, bankruptcy, or criminal charges. 
    
3.  Each party is liable for his task (as per responsibility chart in exhibit A, C and D)
    

8.  **Further Actions:** 
    

1.  **Both Parties will explore the optimal structure for marketing and implementing the Second Party's technology for potential projects for the Municipality of Baghdad. Alliances with third parties may be considered on a case-by-case basis and upon mutual approval by both parties in advance.**
    
2.  **This Agreement will be the basis for the final signed Agreement to be drafted in Iraq and notarized by a public notary in Baghdad, Iraq.**
    

9.  **Exclusivity**: This Agreement is based on exclusive teaming arrangement for the Municipality of Baghdad.  The exclusivity granted in this Agreement is based on First Party availability to perform. Each party has the right to terminate this exclusive teaming arrangement with three months’ written notice.  Exclusive arrangement is not implied or granted in other areas.  Terms and conditions in this Agreement are for the two projects stated in this Agreement.  Any future work will be negotiated on a project-by-project basis.  Participation of other partners may be considered depending on the need for such partnership.  Each party will be responsible for their expenses for marketing and presentations.
    

10.  This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement of the Parties and supersedes any prior written or oral agreements between them relating to the Information; may only be amended by a written document duly signed by the Parties; and shall be binding upon the successors and assigns of each of the Parties.
    

11.  The Parties representatives signing this agreement each has the full authority to enter into this Agreement and to disclose the Information.
    

12.  **Indemnification:**
    

1.  Each Party agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the other Party and their respective directors, officers, employees, agents, and representatives from and against any claims, demands, suits, actions, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorney's fees) arising out of or in connection with any breach of this Term Sheet, any act or omission by the indemnifying Party, or any infringement of intellectual property rights. This indemnification shall survive the termination of this agreement.
    
2.  Second Party liability is limited to the design of the project including error and omission (E&O) causing failure to achieve the project objectives and meeting regular design practice and standards.  Second Party is not liable for First Party not following the design plans and specifications or deviating from standard construction practices weather or not being identified or notified by the Second  Party’s Oversite team or the design consultant. ?
    

13.     **Duration:** 
    

Activation of this Agreement starts upon the singing the first contract with the Municipality for either of the referenced projects above.   Duration of this Agreement is for the duration of the project and terminates upon final completion of construction.  

**IN WITNESS WHEREOF,** the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the date stated below. 

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

SIGNED BY 

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

SIGNED BY 

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

SIGNED BY.

**EXHIBIT A – Responsibility Matrix**

**EXHIBIT B – Party Contractual Relationship**

**EXHIBIT C – First Party Responsibilities**

**Scope of Services**.  Complete the construction of the project described in the design-build contract between the client and first party and according to the plans and specifications developed as part of the design provided by the Second Party.

*   One 150,000 m3/d average flow wastewater treatment plant at the Medical City and or Zuit Factory outfall location.
    
*   Liquid phase only with solids to be transported off site.
    
*   Discharge of disinfected effluent to Tigris River during wet weather conditions (combined sewer overflow).
    

**Outline of Services.**

*   Project management 
    
*   Recruitment of all type of manpower needed for the project including all subcontractors 
    

*   Enter contract with the municipality of Baghdad for the design build of the project.?
    
*   Provide labor and construction equipment appropriate for the scope of work and size of the project.
    
*   Purchase project equipment per plans and specifications.
    
*   Perform land survey, geotechnical investigation, sewer survey per design consultant request.
    
*   Collect information from the municipality to support the design which includes but not limited to pump station flow data, influent water quality, property ownership and boundary delineation, permit and approval requirements, other information needed by the design engineer.  
    
*   Perform on site Column Test as specified by the Second Party. Data from the Column Test will be shared with the Second Party and the design consultant.  
    
*   Share post construction data monitoring test results with the Second Party and the design consultant to assess performance.
    
*   Arrange financing to the project at cost.
    
*   Apply QA/Qc and health and safety procedures at site.
    

**EXHIBIT D – Second Party Responsibilities**

**Scope of Services**.  Professional engineering support services related to Treatment Shaft wastewater treatment facility design and construction observation as part of a design-build contract Between (First party and The Client).  The scope of work is as follows:

*   150,000 m3/d average flow wastewater treatment plant at the Medical City and or Zuit Factory outfall location
    

*   Treatment plant to incorporate specified technology and any future modifications as stated in this agreement.
    
*   Liquid phase only with solids to be transported off site.
    
*   Discharge of disinfected effluent to Tigris River during wet weather conditions (combined sewer overflow).
    

**Outline of Services.**

*   Assessing qualifications, interviewing and final selection of a design engineering consultant.
    
*   Coordinate and work directly with the design consultant and ensure critical design criteria and information are communicated to the design consultant and implemented in the design.
    
*   Assist First Party in establishment of permitting requirements.
    
*   Coordinate between design consultant and First Party to complete land survey,  
    
*   soils exploration, identify utility location and define property limits available for the project.
    
*   Preliminary design/layout - with Owner input and acceptance.
    
*   Budget and cost tracking of design consultant and managing any change orders or additional services required by the team.
    
*   Oversee and manage design consultant including work progress, developing design details, provide input to consultant on timely basis and monitor compliance of the design with the project design criteria and performance expectations. 
    
*   Assist First Party in final selection of equipment and construction procedures.
    
*   Provide construction observation by qualified staff including civil and E/M. Full or part time resident engineer supported with others including other specialized disciplines (QA/QC) depending on work progress and demand.  The First Party will provide furnished site trailer or office with electricity, internet, and other supplies to oversight engineers.
    
*   Timely response to field conditions that require design consultant’s input.
    
*   Review supplier submittals and assist in addressing requests for information.
    
*   Review shop drawings and as built drawings prepared by the First Party.
    
*   Participation in First Party production of O&M manual.
    
*   The Second Party has no defined role or budget during the first year of operation if offered by the First Party.  If the First Party requests Second Party contribution, Second Party scope and budget will be determined at that time and submitted to the First Party for approval prior to commencing the work.   
    

**Client’s Representative.**  The Client (the Municipality) shall designate a representative capable responding to day to day activities and communication., changing orders and similar documents.  The Second Party will assist the First Party in responding to client representative’s comments and request for information.

**Performance.**  The Second Party shall exercise the normal standard of care and diligence in performing the professional services explicitly described in this agreement as normally employed by other professionals performing the same or similar services, 

**Subcontractors.**  The Second Party will engage subconsultants and other specialized engineers to perform a portion of the services to be provided by the Second Party.

**Cost Estimates.**  Since the Second Party has no control over the cost of labor and materials and/or market conditions, any estimates of equipment, construction or operating costs will be made based on the Second Party experience, but the Second Party does not warrant the accuracy of such estimates as compared to contractors’ bids or the First Party incurred.

**Underground Structures or Utilities.**  In the performance of its services, The Second Party will take reasonable care and precautions to avoid damage to underground structures or utilities.  The First Pary agrees to indemnify, protect, and hold harmless the Second Party from and against all liability, claims, demands, losses, expenses and costs (including attorney’s fees) for and damage to or consequential loss from damage to any underground structures or utilities which are not called to The Second Party’s attention or which are not currently shown on plans furnished to the Second Party.

**Site Conditions.**  The First Party recognizes that the presence of hazardous materials or pollution on or beneath the surface of a site may create risks and liabilities.  The Second Party has neither created nor contributed to this pollution.  Consequently, the First Party recognizes and hereby acknowledges that the First Party will accordingly limit the Second Party’s liability.?

**Shop Drawings.**  If shop drawing review is provided, The Second Party will check and review samples, catalog data, schedules, shop drawings, laboratory, shop and mill tests of materials and equipment, and all other data which the First Party is required to submit, only for conformance with the design concept of the Project and compliance with the information given by the construction Contract Documents.

**Documents.**  All project documents, drawings, files, working papers or other materials, whether written or electronic, prepared, or furnished to the First Party by Second Party are intended for the specific purposes of this project only.  Any reuse of said documents, drawings, files, working papers or other materials after they have left the custody of the Second Party shall be at the user’s sole risk without liability to, or cause of action against, the Second Party.

**Construction Phase Services.**  The Second Party will provide construction observation or oversite services as part of this Agreement. The Second Party has no liability regarding the compliance of the First Party construction according to Construction Documents prepared by the Second Party.

**Third Party Rights.**  The Second Party will not confer any rights or benefits under this Agreement to parties other than the First Party and the Second Party.

\---End of Agreement---

**Site Conditions.**  The First Party recognizes that the presence of hazardous materials or pollution on or beneath the surface of a site may create risks and liabilities.  The Second Party has neither created nor contributed to this pollution.  Consequently, the First Party recognizes and hereby acknowledges that the First Party will accordingly limit the Second Party’s liability.?

**Shop Drawings.**  If shop drawing review is provided, The Second Party will check and review samples, catalog data, schedules, shop drawings, laboratory, shop and mill tests of materials and equipment, and all other data which the First Party is required to submit, only for conformance with the design concept of the Project and compliance with the information given by the construction Contract Documents.

**Documents.**  All project documents, drawings, files, working papers or other materials, whether written or electronic, prepared, or furnished to the First Party by Second Party are intended for the specific purposes of this project only.  Any reuse of said documents, drawings, files, working papers or other materials after they have left the custody of the Second Party shall be at the user’s sole risk without liability to, or cause of action against, the Second Party.

**Construction Phase Services.**  The Second Party will provide construction observation or oversite services as part of this Agreement. The Second Party has no liability regarding the compliance of the First Party construction according to Construction Documents prepared by the Second Party.

**Third Party Rights.**  The Second Party will not confer any rights or benefits under this Agreement to parties other than the First Party and the Second Party.

messages.content:
Based on the details provided in the contract, it appears that Party 1 (the joint venture between Windows General Contracting Ltd. and Advance Pipeline Services) has a better deal in some respects, while Party 2 (Water Engineering Technologies) has some advantages in other areas.

Here are some key points in favor of each party:

Party 1 Advantages:

- Will be the lead contractor handling project management, construction, procurement, etc. This likely means they will have greater control over the project.

- Entitled to 18% profit sharing on the project based on the calculation formula laid out. This could result in significant profits.

- Has exclusivity working with Party 2 on wastewater projects for the Municipality of Baghdad. Gives them a competitive edge.

Party 2 Advantages: 

- Will receive a $3 million lump sum royalty fee.

- Payment covered for engineering design services and construction oversight team.

- Liability is limited related to design flaws or issues. Party 1 takes on more project risk.

There are also some unclear areas or potential disadvantages:

- Party 1 has to cover some Party 2 expenses that exceed budgets (e.g. design costs).

- Dispute resolution gives both parties representation, but ultimate venue is Baghdad courts which may favor Party 1.

So in summary, Party 1 likely takes on more project risk but has greater potential reward via profit sharing, while Party 2 gets paid upfront and has less project liability. Overall it appears to be a mutually beneficial partnership, with both sides getting something meaningful out of the deal. But Party 1 may come out ahead if all goes smoothly.

messages.content: what are some likely options for party two to gain some ground without disrupting the negotiation too much

content.text: what are some likely options for party two to gain some ground without disrupting the negotiation too much

messages.content:
Here are some options Party Two (Water Engineering Technologies) could potentially pursue to try to improve their position without disrupting the negotiations too much:

1. Seek to increase royalty percentage on profit sharing. They're currently getting a flat 18% fee. Even a small bump to 20% or 22% on a large contract value could make a significant difference.

2. Request concrete payment schedule for the $3 million royalty fee to ensure it's fully paid, rather than vague prorated payments. Defined 25% installments or payments tied to clear milestones.

3. Add language that design cost overruns beyond the initial budget are shared 50/50 with Party One instead of fully paid by Party One.

4. Reduce Party Two's liability further to cover only direct negligence rather than broader design flaws. Strengthen indemnification from Party One.

5. Clarify dispute resolution has recourse to an international venue or arbitration if Baghdad courts rule against Party Two's interests. 

6. Seek specific language or assurances around intellectual property protections and future licensing of the technologies to Party One or others.

7. Increase the notice period and define conditions more precisely for Party One being able to terminate the exclusivity arrangement.

The key is reasonable requests focused on tilting more percentages, profits, protections or limiting liabilities further toward Party Two, without fundamentally altering the overall split collaboration model or asking for too much that could risk the deal. Reasonable counteroffers may get accepted.

messages.content: is it possible to get a clause that makes sense that provides early funding (now) so party two can hire and start work before the contract is even signed and funding unlocked from the iraqi gov?

content.text: is it possible to get a clause that makes sense that provides early funding (now) so party two can hire and start work before the contract is even signed and funding unlocked from the iraqi gov?

messages.content:
Yes, it is possible to add a clause to provide early funding for Party Two to begin hiring and starting work before the main contract is signed with the Iraqi government. Here is a draft clause that aims to achieve that:

Pre-Contract Initiation Funding:

To enable Party Two to begin critical preparation work, Party One shall provide initial advance funding of $500,000 to Party Two within 30 days of signing this Agreement. These one-time funds shall be used for staff recruitment and contracting, preliminary engineering evaluations, travel, and other initiations expenses to mobilize Party Two's teams prior to final contract approval with the Client. 

The advance payment shall be an advance on royalty payments due to Party Two. If the main project ultimately does not proceed for any reason, unexpended portions of this advance shall be returned to Party One within 120 days following contract cancellation notification.

Expenses reports shall be provided every 30 days to justify advance usage. Priority expenditures must be pre-approved by the steering committee in writing before allocating advance funds towards them.

The Pre-Contract Initiation Funding provision shall survive termination and supersedes other payment clauses in this Agreement for the purposes of these one-time mobilization funds.

Let me know if some adjustments would better achieve your aims with this type of preparatory funding clause. I tried to cover the parameters and conditions for getting some early funding for starting critical work activities before having the final signed contract in place.
